name: src/index.js
Cancellable
description: Represents a state of cancellation and activation.

name: create
description: Creates a Cancellable instance.

name: cancelled
description: Returns true if the Cancellable is cancelled.

name: active
description: Returns true if the Cancellable is active.

name: enable
description:
Enables a Cancellable.

Fails to enable if the Cancellable instance is
already cancelled.

name: disable
description:
Disables a Cancellable.

Fails to disable if the Cancellable instance is
already cancelled.

name: isParentTo
description: Checks if this Cancellable is a parent of the given Cancellable (hierarchy).

name: setParent
description:
Sets the given Cancellable as a parent Cancellable.

if the given Cancellable is already cancelled, this
Cancellable is cancelled as well.

name: removeParent
description: Removes the parent Cancellable

name: add
description:
Adds a Cancellable as a child Cancellable.

Child Disposables are cancelled, enabled and disabled if their
parent Cancellable is cancelled as well.

A child Cancellable cannot have more than one parent Cancellable.

If a child Cancellable is added to a parent Cancellable that is
already cancelled, the child Cancellable is cancelled.

name: remove
description: Removes a direct child Cancellable.

params.name: cancellable
params.description: The child Cancellable to be removed.

name: cancel
description:
Disposes the instance.

If the Cancellable instance has more than one children, the
child Disposables are cancelled as well.

name: addEventListener
description: Registers a listener function to a target event dispatcher.

params.name: ev
params.description:
Defines the event target
- enable: fires whenever the Cancellable is enabled.
- disable: fires whenever the Cancellable is disabled.
- cancel: fires when the Cancellable is cancelled.

params.name: fn
params.description: a function to be called when the event is dispatched.

name: removeEventListener
description: Removes a listener function from a target event dispatcher.

params.name: ev
params.description:
Defines the event target
- enable: fires whenever the Cancellable is enabled.
- disable: fires whenever the Cancellable is disabled.
- cancel: fires when the Cancellable is cancelled.

params.name: fn
params.description: a function from be removed from the target event dispatcher.

content:
# rx-cancellable

Reactive Extensions - represents a state of cancellation

[![NPM](https://nodei.co/npm/rx-cancellable.png)](https://nodei.co/npm/rx-cancellable/)

[![](https://data.jsdelivr.com/v1/package/npm/rx-cancellable/badge)](https://www.jsdelivr.com/package/npm/rx-cancellable)
[![HitCount](http://hits.dwyl.io/lxsmnsyc/rx-cancellable.svg)](http://hits.dwyl.io/lxsmnsyc/rx-cancellable)

| Platform | Build Status |
| --- | --- |
| Linux | [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/LXSMNSYC/rx-cancellable.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/LXSMNSYC/rx-cancellable) |
| Windows | [![Build status](https://ci.appveyor.com/api/projects/status/mkjwe462uk80axx4?svg=true)](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/LXSMNSYC/rx-cancellable) |


[![codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/LXSMNSYC/rx-cancellable/branch/master/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/gh/LXSMNSYC/rx-cancellable)
[![Known Vulnerabilities](https://snyk.io/test/github/LXSMNSYC/rx-cancellable/badge.svg?targetFile=package.json)](https://snyk.io/test/github/LXSMNSYC/rx-cancellable?targetFile=package.json)

## Install

NPM

```bash
npm i rx-cancellable
```

CDN

* jsDelivr
```html
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/rx-cancellable/dist/index.min.js"></script>
```

* unpkg
```html
<script src="https://unpkg.com/rx-cancellable/dist/index.min.js"></script>
```

## Usage

### Loading the module

#### CommonJS

```js
const Disposable = require('rx-cancellable');
```

Loading the CommonJS module provides the Disposable class.

#### Browser

Loading the JavaScript file for the rx-cancellable provides the Disposable class

## Documentation

You can read the documentation at the [official doc site](https://lxsmnsyc.github.io/rx-cancellable/)

## Build

Clone the repo first, then run the following to install the dependencies

```bash
npm install
```

To build the coverages, run the test suite, the docs, and the distributable modules:

```bash
npm run build
```
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "rx-cancellable",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "description": "Reactive Extensions - represents the state of cancellation",
  "main": "index.js",
  "directories": {
    "test": "test"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "linux-mocha": "./node_modules/.bin/mocha --require @babel/register -R spec --recursive",
    "linux-test": "./node_modules/.bin/nyc --reporter=html npm run linux-mocha",
    "linux-docs": "./node_modules/.bin/esdoc",
    "linux-cjs": "./node_modules/.bin/rollup src/index.js --format cjs --name \"Disposable\" --file index.js",
    "linux-browser": "./node_modules/.bin/rollup src/index.js --format iife --name \"Disposable\" --file dist/index.js",
    "linux-minify": "npm run linux-browser && ./node_modules/.bin/terser dist/index.js --compress --mangle --output dist/index.min.js",
    "linux-build": "npm run linux-cjs && npm run linux-minify && npm run linux-docs && npm run linux-test",
    "win-mocha": "node node_modules/mocha/bin/mocha --require @babel/register -R spec --recursive",
    "win-test": "node node_modules/nyc/bin/nyc.js --reporter=html npm run win-mocha",
    "win-docs": "node node_modules/esdoc/out/src/ESDocCLI.js",
    "win-cjs": "node node_modules/.bin/rollup src/index.js --format cjs --name \"Disposable\" --file index.js",
    "win-browser": "node node_modules/.bin/rollup src/index.js --format iife --name \"Disposable\" --file dist/index.js",
    "win-minify": "npm run win-browser && node node_modules/.bin/terser dist/index.js --compress --mangle --output dist/index.min.js",
    "win-build": "npm run win-cjs && npm run win-minify && npm run win-docs && npm run win-test",
    "mocha": "npm run linux-mocha || npm run win-mocha",
    "test": "npm run linux-test || npm run win-test",
    "docs": "npm run linux-docs || npm run win-docs",
    "cjs": "npm run linux-cjs || npm run win-cjs",
    "browser": "npm run linux-browser || npm run win-browser",
    "minify": "npm run linux-minify || npm run win-minify",
    "build": "npm run cjs && npm run minify && npm run docs && npm test"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/LXSMNSYC/rx-cancellable.git"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "rx",
    "rxjs",
    "reactive-extensions",
    "cancellable"
  ],
  "author": "LXSMNSYC (alexis.munsayac@gmail.com)",
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/LXSMNSYC/rx-cancellable/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/LXSMNSYC/rx-cancellable#readme",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.4.3",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.4.3",
    "@babel/register": "^7.4.0",
    "acorn": "^6.1.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-integrate-test-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^5.16.0",
    "eslint-config-airbnb-base": "^13.1.0",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.16.0",
    "mocha": "^6.1.2",
    "nyc": "^13.3.0",
    "rollup": "^1.9.3",
    "terser": "^3.17.0"
  }
}
name: package.json
test/index.js
describe0
description: Cancellable

name: describe1
description: #create

name: it2
description: should create a Cancellable

name: describe3
description: #active

name: it4
description: should return true if Cancellable is enabled.

name: it5
description: should return false if Cancellable is disabled.

name: it6
description: should return true if Cancellable is disabled then enabled.

name: it7
description: should return true if Cancellable is enabled, cancelled, and disabled.

name: it8
description: should return true if Cancellable is disabled, cancelled, and enabled.

name: describe9
description: #cancelled

name: it10
description: should return true if Cancellable is cancelled.

name: it11
description: should return true if Cancellable is not cancelled.

name: describe12
description: #cancel

name: it13
description: should return true if Cancellable is cancelled for the first time.

name: it14
description: should return false if Cancellable has been cancelled before.

name: describe15
description: #enable

name: it16
description: should return true if Cancellable is enabled after being disabled.

name: it17
description: should return false if Cancellable is enabled already.

name: describe18
description: #disable

name: it19
description: should return true if Cancellable is disabled after being enabled.

name: it20
description: should return false if Cancellable is disabled already.

name: describe21
description: #setParent

name: it22
description: should return false if the Cancellable parent given is the same as the child

name: it23
description: should return false if the Cancellable parent given is not a Cancellable

name: it24
description: should return false if the Cancellable parent given is a child of the source Cancellable

name: it25
description: should return false if the Cancellable parent is already cancelled.

name: it26
description: should the children be cancelled if the parent is cancelled

name: it27
description: should the children be disabled if the parent is disabled

name: describe28
description: #remove

name: it29
description: should return false if the Cancellable given is not the child.

name: it30
description: should return false if the source is already cancelled.

name: it31
description: should return true if the removal is successful

name: describe32
description: #addEventListener

name: it33
description: should fire the enable listener if the Cancellable is enabled

name: it34
description: should fire the disable listener if the Cancellable is disabled

name: it35
description: should fire the cancel listener if the Cancellable is cancelled

name: it36
description: should not fire the cancel listener if the Cancellable is already cancelled

name: describe37
description: #removeEventListener

name: it38
description: should not fire the enable listener if the Cancellable is enabled

name: it39
description: should not fire the disable listener if the Cancellable is disabled

name: it40
description: should not fire the cancel listener if the Cancellable is cancelled
